org.j2free.email
Class SimpleEmailService

java.lang.Object
  org.j2free.email.SimpleEmailService

public class SimpleEmailService
extends java.lang.Object

Static wrapper around a single EmailService

Nested Class Summary
static class SimpleEmailService.DiscardPolicy
          Implements EmailService.ErrorPolicy to discard failed messages writing only a message to the log.
static class SimpleEmailService.RequeuePolicy
          Implements EmailService.ErrorPolicy to requeue the message at the specified Priority.

isDummy

public static boolean isDummy()
Returns:
true if "dummy" mode is enabled (meaning that e-mails will be accepted but not sent), otheriwse false

shutdown

public static boolean shutdown(long timeout,
                               java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Shutdown the service, first waiting the specified timeout for previously accepted emails to be sent. Note: new emails will not be accepted after this method has been called.

Parameters:
timeout -
unit -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

                                    Template template,
                                    boolean isDefault)
Parameters:
key - The key to store the template under
template - The template for an e-mail
isDefault - Whether this should be the default template when sendTemplate is called using the version without a template parameter

                      throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException,

                             java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
Sends a plain text e-mail at the default priority

Parameters:
from - The "from" e-mail address
to - The recipient's e-mail address

body - The body of the message

sendPlain

public static void sendPlain(KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> from,
                             java.lang.String to,
                             java.lang.String subject,
                             java.lang.String body,
                             Priority priority,
                             boolean ccSender)
                      throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                             javax.mail.MessagingException,
                             java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
Sends a plain text e-mail

Parameters:
from - The "from" e-mail address
to - The recipient's e-mail address
subject - The subject of the e-mail
body - The body of the message
priority - The priority this message should take if there are other queued messages
ccSender - If true, cc's the from address on the e-mail sent, otherwise does not.
Throws:
javax.mail.internet.AddressException - if the FROM or TO address is invalid
javax.mail.MessagingException
java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if EmailService has already been shutdown

sendTemplate

public static void sendTemplate(KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> from,
                                java.lang.String to,
                                java.lang.String subject,
                                KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>... params)
                         throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                                javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                TemplateException,
                                java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
Sends a HTML e-mail based on the default template at the default priority

Parameters:
from - The "from" e-mail address
to - The recipient's e-mail address
subject - The subject of the e-mail
params - An array of pairs of dynamic attributes for the template; i.e. for a template with dynamic section "body", new KeyValuePair<String,String>("body",body);
Throws:
javax.mail.internet.AddressException - if the FROM or TO address is invalid
javax.mail.MessagingException
TemplateException - if the default template has not been set, or there are unreplaced tokens
java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if EmailService has already been shutdown

javax.mail.MessagingException
TemplateException - if the default template has not been set, or there are unreplaced tokens

sendTemplate

public static void sendTemplate(KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> from,
                                java.lang.String to,
                                java.lang.String subject,
                                java.lang.String templateKey,
                                KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>... params)
                         throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                                javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                TemplateException,
                                java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
Sends a HTML e-mail based on a template at the defualt priority

Parameters:
from - The "from" e-mail address
to - The recipient's e-mail address
subject - The subject of the e-mail
templateKey - The key to look up the e-mail template
params - An array of pairs of dynamic attributes for the template; i.e. for a template with dynamic section "body", new KeyValuePair<String,String>("body",body);
Throws:
javax.mail.internet.AddressException - if the FROM or TO address is invalid
javax.mail.MessagingException
TemplateException - if the specified template has not been registered, or there are unreplaced tokens
java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if EmailService has already been shutdown

sendTemplate

public static void sendTemplate(KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> from,
                                javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress[] recipients,
                                java.lang.String subject,
                                java.lang.String templateKey,
                                KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>... params)
                         throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                                javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                TemplateException,
                                java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
Sends a HTML e-mail based on a template at the defualt priority

Parameters:
from - The "from" e-mail address
recipients -
subject - The subject of the e-mail
templateKey - The key to look up the e-mail template
params - An array of pairs of dynamic attributes for the template; i.e. for a template with dynamic section "body", new KeyValuePair<String,String>("body",body);
Throws:
javax.mail.internet.AddressException - if the FROM or TO address is invalid
javax.mail.MessagingException
TemplateException - if the specified template has not been registered, or there are unreplaced tokens
java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if EmailService has already been shutdown

sendTemplate

public static void sendTemplate(KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> from,
                                java.lang.String to,
                                java.lang.String subject,
                                java.lang.String templateKey,
                                Priority priority,
                                KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>... params)
                         throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                                javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                TemplateException,
                                java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
Sends a HTML e-mail based on a template

Parameters:
from - The "from" e-mail address
to - The recipient's e-mail address
subject - The subject of the e-mail
templateKey - The key to look up the e-mail template
priority - The priority this message should take if there are other queued messages
params - An array of pairs of dynamic attributes for the template; i.e. for a template with dynamic section "body", new KeyValuePair<String,String>("body",body);
Throws:
javax.mail.internet.AddressException - if the FROM or TO address is invalid
javax.mail.MessagingException
TemplateException - if the specified template has not been registered, or there are unreplaced tokens
java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if EmailService has already been shutdown

sendTemplate

public static void sendTemplate(KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> from,
                                java.lang.String to,
                                java.lang.String subject,
                                Priority priority,
                                boolean ccSender,
                                KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>... params)
                         throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                                javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                TemplateException,
                                java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException
Sends a HTML e-mail based on the default template

Parameters:
from - The "from" e-mail address
to - The recipient's e-mail address
subject - The subject of the e-mail
priority - The priority this message should take if there are other queued messages
ccSender - If true, cc's the from address on the e-mail sent, otherwise does not.
params - An array of pairs of dynamic attributes for the template; i.e. for a template with dynamic section "body", new KeyValuePair<String,String>("body",body);
Throws:
javax.mail.internet.AddressException - if the FROM or TO address is invalid
javax.mail.MessagingException
TemplateException - if the default template has not been set, or there are unreplaced tokens
java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if EmailService has already been shutdown

sendTemplate

                                Priority priority,
                                boolean ccSender,
                                KeyValuePair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>... params)
                         throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                                javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                TemplateException,
                                java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException

Throws:
javax.mail.internet.AddressException - if the FROM or TO address is invalid
javax.mail.MessagingException
TemplateException - if the default template has not been set, or there are unreplaced tokens
